rdf:Description.dc:title: Soil microbiology in land reclamation 1984
rdf:Description.dc:creator: Alberta. Reclamation Research Technical Advisory Committee.
Alberta. Alberta Environment. Research Management Division.
rdf:Description.dc:publisher: Edmonton : Alberta Land Conservation and Reclamation Council, Reclamation Research Technical Advisory Committee,
rdf:Description.dc:description: A final report prepared for Alberta Land Conservation and Reclamation Council, Reclamation Research Technical Advisory Committee and Research Management Division, Alberta Environment. -- Includes bibliographies

v. 1. Reinstatement of biological activity in severely disturbed soils : effects of mining on the microbiology of three minespoils and the microbial development in the minespoils after amendation and planting / Visser, S, Griffiths, C, Parkinson, D -- v. 1. Reinstatement of biological activity in severely disturbed soils : effects of different amendments to three different minespoils on selected soil physical and chemical properties and on plant growth / Visser, S -- v. 2. Greenhouse pot studies dealing with amendation of oil sand tailings : effects of peat, sewage sludge and fertilizer on plant growth, mycorrhizae and microbial activity / Parkinson, D -- v. 2. Reinstatement of biological activity in severely disturbed soils : vesicular-arbuscular mycorrhizal development of slender wheatgrass on amended oil sand tailings and subalpine coal mine spoil / Zak, J, Griffiths, C, Parkinson, D -- v. 2. Reinstatement of biological activity in severely disturbed soils : ectomycorrhizae in amended oil sand tailings and subalpine coal mine spoil and in undisturbed jack pine and spruce stands / Danielson, R.M, Griffiths, C, Parkinson, D.
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Reclamation of land.
Soil microbiology.
